reviews.review_msg: The worst instructor I met ever, in the news, in the news, in the news, why don't you work in the Journalism? Here is the school ok?

Ilia really is a good prof, he is heavy on class activities but also provides valuable insights for your work. The key is to use the feedback and use it in your work. He's happy to answer all the questions, but it's not a regular class, it's heavily based on your actually learning rather than the tests, which is I suppose gonna help irl?!

Ilia is the best professor ever! His teaching style promotes interesting academic advancement, and by blending business theory with current events, he brings the subject matter to life, making every lesson a unique and practical learning experience. Ilia also provides useful feedback, pointing out areas where a student could make improvements.

Taking Business 216, with Ilia Bykov was a transformative experience, not just academically but also in personal growth. His engaging teaching style and intertwining business theory with current events brought the subject matter to life, making each class a unique and practical learning experience. This course helped me confirm Business as my major
Not recommended overall; teach nothing in the class but test the textbook in the midterm.
If you don't teach anything in class, the students don't know where the points are deducted. He's not fit to teach. Choose another professor rather than him....
Do not take this course with him!!!!!!!! He is so terrible. He doesn't teach anything in class and he is very intimidating.

Taking this class with Ilia is sure to boost your presentation skills as well as confidence. This course is very group work loaded (40% approx grade) and heavy so be prepared to commit to your group in order to achieve success in the course. Attend his office hours to get good feedbacks and support on your improvement.

Ilia is an amazing instructor, so helpful and understanding. This class requires lots of work and class participation. You can really improve your writing and presentation skills. The group project is the main assignment you will have, and it is extremely cool but also hard, so choose your teammates wisely. Overall amazing and extremely useful.

His 216 classes are very practical and fun. You have to be very active to get a high participation grade. Analyze your classmates carefully and choose members for your group project. Group projects deserve 40% of the overall grade.

I definitely recommend taking BUS216 with Ilia. Lectures are very valuable for both academic and personal life. Ilia's way of teaching and engaging with students makes him a great prof. This course requires a lot of team works. Participation in class matters. I suggest enrolling in his class as soon as possible because his class gets full quickly.
I highly recommend Ilia to be your professor he helps you in and out of class giving u the best support. Also just don't miss anything and ask smart question then you would be fine.

I previously took BUS200 with him, and always find studying business to be so aspirational and fascinating. I appreciate the way he challenges everyone to perform to the best of their abilities. I think you should have the confidence to establish a connection because he adapts to your understanding individually and helps you improve as a person.

After taking his course, I can say that please don't. He does not teach anything in class, you have to learn it yourself from textbook. (Then what is the point of lecture??, I can just self taught without paying you) He does not offer any help, other than saying 'talk to me in Office Hour'. DONT TAKE IT, he only cares about a few students.

Ilia is the best. The best. He will make you work for it, but he awards risks. He will be the most charming professor ever. Had the best time with him. Lots of group participation, and make sure to contribute a lot in the team work. Most fun class I ever had. I'm thankful for a professor like him!!!

He is one of the best professors I got so far, very inspirational and professional. The course is so organised and well planned. Right at the beginning of every lecture, we will have a business communication news session, which keep all of us in touch with the business world. We also learn how a professional team works including business writing.

Ilia is very good professor for Bus216. Don't blame him for your low grades. Course is in general difficult but if you are here for learning something for real world, he could help you in best possible way. His teaching is not just confined to textbook but also beyond book. Best part of his course is his office hours.
He is a very patient teacher. Each assignment will give you a very detailed feedback. He replies to messages very quickly and always helps me solve problems in time.

I don't know if I would take him again, he's really serious which often may seem rude, from my perspective. I got a B, which was a surprise for me, he really makes you work for your grade, so get ready to do things his way. Tip: DO NOT MISS ANY INTEXT CITATION, he's really strict with that.
The worst I have ever seen, skip at all cost

For me Ilia has been more like a mentor. I have personally learnt a lot of important things from him like time management, how to deliver quality work and much more. He was always there to support me during the office hours and would reply to all of my course related texts in minutes. He teaches really well and I would take him for all BUS courses

Ilia is not a teacher who always smiles at you. He is a tough teacher who always pointed out your mistakes. He is also a tough grader, you need to do extra things to get a high grade. However, he is really a good teacher who taught me lots of useful business skills. He would also give some extra feedback during his office once a week. Appreciated!
Ilia is a very good instructor. Give true feedback on performance.

Ilia will help you as long as you work for it. There are no "shortcuts" in this course. I took an intersession course so it was a bit more rigorous and time-consuming. However, it was worth it, giving me invaluable skills and experiences that are now on my résumé. Take this course with him if you are willing to work hard.

Ilia was a very tough teacher in his on way but he really wants the student to improve in their communication skill and being an active listener. The course is more on the practical sides about team works and assignment that will needed in the future. He gives a really good feedback during the office hour which can help us to improve our grade.

Ilia makes you work for what you aim for. Make sure you always show up during office hours & keep on asking for feedback. As long as he knows you're hard working, he will appreciate it. Kind of intimidating at first, but can be funny too. His lectures are mostly based off his own life / class related examples. Get ready to read the book preclasses.

The best professor Ive had so far. If you work hard and stay consistent you can definitely get a B+. Youll have to work even harder and go above and beyond to get A or A-. Always go to the office hours for valuable feedback. Ilia can be really amazing if you follow him and try to be the best.

If you ever get the chance to take the course with Ilia  do so, but be ready to work hard. Ilia is a perfectionist and requires the same attitude to work from you. With this being said, he is a very thoughtful professor who gives good feedback and helps you succeed if you ask for his advice. I definitely enjoyed BUS216, must-have class I'd say.

Ilia is the most helpful professor that I've ever met. He provides a variety of practical knowledge including his BUS216 class and weekly workshops. Furthermore, he also gives some of the best advice that I've had, including relationship handling, career development, emotional management, etc. It is simple to have high grades: just work hard.

I took Ilia for both 200 and 216 and he is the best prof ever. He may be strict in grading, but I promise it will benefit you, especially if you're taking 216. He makes you work hard and cares much about the details. Attending his office hours is a must to get good feedback, or just chitchat if you have any concerns in life.

Ilia is the best BUS216 professor because he always:  Encourage his students to step out of their comfort zone  Consciously help his students as best as he can  Show his passion, enthusiasm, and dedication in his teaching  Give his students a taste of working in a professional environment  Make tons of hysterical jokes :))
Nice teacher

Ilia is a great professor. He treats the class like a workspace, meaning you have to act professional. And the fact I want to stress is 'PARTICIPATE' in his class. If you lay low, you won't get participation marks. Which is believe 15% ( please check). Believe me, you'll learn a lot of things in his class.

IIia is a really nice, kind and talkative Instructor. He is always willing to help students outside class. At the same time, Bus216 is not an easy course. It needs your qualified and solid English writing skills. You have to participate in the class frequently, or your participation marks will not be good. Pay full attention on how to write email

BUS216 with Ilia was challenging, not impossible to ace. You actually have to put in the work. So if you dont like to work, you probably wont enjoy his class. If you want someone to help you sharpen your skills and tell you where youre doing it wrong so you could be better, youll absolutely love his class and get a lot of value from it.

Ilia as an instructor has so much value to offer to any student having been down the same road. Attendance being mandatory but flexible and office hours beneficial, his courses wont be a cakewalk for any student. However, taking advantage of the resources he has to offer will help in obtaining a good grade. An A+ is hard to get but achievable.

To be honest I think people either love Ilias class or hate it. Pros: you actually learn valuable things about writing business emails and presentation skills. Cons: his classes are (imo) boring because most of the time he just goes on very long rants (but some people like it). I personally find it tedious to attend his class but hes a nice guy.

Before I took this course, a lot of friends told me that his was very strict but actually i don't very agree with that. He was so nice and fair for every one. If you work hard but your member not good or not cooperation, don't worry. Just tell Ilia and he would change your grade would not be lower because of your group member. Trust me, choose Ilia

At first, you will hate Ilia but in the end, you will love him. He is not a bad teacher and actually teaches the class. His class is useful and will be useful in the future as well. Understand that business writing is hard in general as you need to be precise with the wording and format. Overall, Ilia is a teacher that genuinely teaches but hard
He's a great listener and helps you with mostly everything. learned a lot from him. he's really strict with presentations but at the end he's so kind.

Ilia helps a lot when you attend his office hours, makes it clear what he expects from you. Talking about participation grade, it doesn't matter what you say, you should talk as much as possible. Don't be late, submit on time,don't miss classes and ask for feedback as often as possible. He makes the course very interesting,often shares experience.

Best teacher ever. He devotes time and effort to helping students as much as he could. Nice and kind, willing to give valuable advice about fields outside the classroom. A lil bit strict in grading but as long as you're hardworking, you'll be fine.
He is very supportive of aspects of both academic and non-academic. He offers more than enough office hours and very valuable feedbacks. He is a good teacher and friend.

Wonderful instructor. Strict but fair. BTW, he is the smartest and most handsome instructor I have ever seen. Do not forget to join his office hour and workshop. They are really helpful. I learnt a lot not only academically but practically applying into life about business communication. Really miss the time learning with you.

Ilia is an instructor who willing to spend the time to interact with students, discuss what has happened in our daily life but not only the business knowledge in the textbook, he gives every student feedback and teaches you how real-world work (some students do not like this). But you will understand "hard work always pays off" in the end.

A handsome teacher, a little bit cool but that makes him more charming. When he talks to you with smiling face, you will feel like facing to a Russian angel. Very excellent teaching style for students major in business. Beedie school should definitely hire him as an instructor.

Firstly, Ilia is an engaged and inspiring instructor who wants to support and help students by teaching many business essential skills. Secondly, he tried to help students collaborate with the team and work hard to get the satisfied result. This course requirement is relative high, but he has the fair rubric to evaluate student's performance.

First, Ilia is an inspired and motivated instructor that he offered you a lot of business knowledge throughout the semester. Secondly, if you are interested in dedicating into business related industries in the future, you will find this course useful and valuable. Lastly, if you pay real effort and attend office hour, you will find it awesome.

Firstly he is a really handsome, smart and cute Russian instructor. Although we had a very tough time this semester for this course and devoted a Hugh amount of time, the effort is worth. We learned more important things in BUS216 class which is communicating with others practically, not just some academic knowledge. Thanks Ilia for your help:)
Miss Ilia for his persuasive advice. He is really nice and I love him foreverrrrrr. Hope to see him next semester in office hour time.

Very good looking, really nice, an amazing prof who is definatly my favorite of all the profs. I took BUS216 which is a really good class, a lot of papers plus a group project which is 40% of the grade. Attend his office hours so he can give you feedback. Really cool to talk to even outside class. Attendance matters, so is participation.

Ilia is great, he will motivate you all the time. Attending his office hour is helpful and enjoyable. But this is really a tough course, although no final, I felt that every week was like final. A lot of homework, group meeting, emails need you to do. Like a nightmare.

He is really handsome!!! You will love him more if you don't take his class. He is strict and assigns lots of works to do, but you can really learn a lot from him! Either by works or his personal experience!

He is handsome and strict. He graduated from SFU master and became an instructor here for business courses. For BUS216, I think it is not much difficult, but you need to spend a lot of time for it. You'd better attend his office hour to let him help you improve your assignment. His grade is a little bit tough, but trying your best you will be good.
